description:
Who we are
  Paracel Laboratories Ltd. (Paracel) is one of the oldest privately owned and operated environmental analytical facilities in Canada. We are a multidisciplinary analytical laboratory specializing in environmental and microbiological Indoor Air Quality services for various industries. At Paracel, our strength lies in our dedicated staff who are committed to providing exceptional client service. Our technical expertise is fundamental in supporting our clients in all aspects of their environmental and IAQ projects.
  The Role
  We are currently seeking a full-time Sample Custodian who will serve as our primary link between our clients and laboratory operations. As part of the Sample Management team and working closely with our Customer Service Representatives (CSRs) and Account Managers, the Sample Custodian will oversee the entire life cycle of samples. The ideal candidate for this role is detail-oriented, an effective communicator, and a team player with exceptional data entry skills. This position is a full-time, permanent role located at our Ottawa East Laboratory.
  Duties and Responsibilities
 
   Receive, verify, and label samples, and accurately enter sample information into the Laboratory Information Management System.
   Collaborate with CSRs, Account Managers, and Lab Analysts to assist in the verification of sample submissions and to resolve routine sample submission issues.
   Process and update customer orders and/or change orders promptly.
   Provide clients with necessary field supplies, such as bottles and sampling media.
   Perform sample pre-treatment when required.
   Monitor and maintain inventory levels of field supplies, forms, and documents.
   Receive deliveries from couriers and suppliers and prepare items for courier pickups.
   Assist CSRs with customer inquiries related to, delivery, order status, returns, and other customer requests.
   Answering incoming calls and greeting client walk-ins.
   Preparing and arranging supply requests and deliveries to clients.
   Processing sales transactions using an online point-of-sale terminal.
   Collaborating with Sample Management and Account Managers to ensure client satisfaction.
   Various general office and administrative tasks, including filing and ordering supplies.
 
  Qualifications
 
   Minimum High School Diploma, with post-secondary education being desired but not essential.
   Experience in Inventory Control or Materials Management is considered an asset.
   Effective communication skills, with the ability to establish and maintain productive work relationships with various staff levels to support the sample management process.
   Strong organizational skills and keen attention to detail.
   Proficiency in computer skills, including MS Office. Data entry experience is an asset.
   Demonstrated initiative, detail-oriented, positive attitude, and the ability to multi-task.
   Proven customer service orientation with a style that demonstrates timely responsiveness.
   Quick learner, effective problem solver, and the ability to follow procedures.
   Ability to work effectively and independently in a fast-paced environment.
   Lab experience is not essential, as training will be provided.
   Must be physically capable of lifting and moving boxes and coolers weighing up to 50lbs on occasion.
 
  Compensation Package
  The compensation package includes full benefits including an Employee Family assistance program, a Group RRSP plan, and a Profit-Sharing program.
  Application Process
  We appreciate all applicants for their interest. However, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.
